extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.gcp.bigquery.PutBigQueryStreaming
extension.description: Load data into Google BigQuery table using the streaming API. This processor is not intended to load large flow files as it will load the full content into memory. If you need to insert large flow files, consider using PutBigQueryBatch instead.

property.name: GCP Credentials Provider Service
property.description: The Controller Service used to obtain Google Cloud Platform credentials.

property.name: gcp-project-id
property.description: Google Cloud Project ID

property.name: gcp-retry-count
property.description: How many retry attempts should be made before routing to the failure relationship.

property.name: gcp-proxy-host
property.description: IP or hostname of the proxy to be used. You might need to set the following properties in bootstrap for https proxy usage: -Djdk.http.auth.tunneling.disabledSchemes= -Djdk.http.auth.proxying.disabledSchemes=

property.name: gcp-proxy-port
property.description: Proxy port number

property.name: gcp-proxy-user-name
property.description: HTTP Proxy Username

property.name: gcp-proxy-user-password
property.description: HTTP Proxy Password

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. If set, it supersedes proxy settings configured per component. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

property.name: bq.dataset
property.description: BigQuery dataset name (Note - The dataset must exist in GCP)

property.name: bq.table.name
property.description: BigQuery table name

property.name: bq.load.ignore_unknown
property.description: Sets whether BigQuery should allow extra values that are not represented in the table schema. If true, the extra values are ignored. If false, records with extra columns are treated as bad records, and if there are too many bad records, an invalid error is returned in the job result. By default unknown values are not allowed.

property.name: bq.record.reader
property.description: Specifies the Controller Service to use for parsing incoming data.

property.name: bq.skip.invalid.rows
property.description: Sets whether to insert all valid rows of a request, even if invalid rows exist. If not set the entire insert request will fail if it contains an invalid row.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship after a successful Google BigQuery operation.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship if the Google BigQuery operation fails.

writesAttribute.name: bq.records.count
writesAttribute.description: Number of records successfully inserted

systemResourceConsideration.description: An instance of this component can cause high usage of this system resource. Multiple instances or high concurrency settings may result a degradation of performance.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.gcp.pubsub.PublishGCPubSub
extension.description: Publishes the content of the incoming flowfile to the configured Google Cloud PubSub topic. The processor supports dynamic properties. If any dynamic properties are present, they will be sent along with the message in the form of 'attributes'.

property.name: gcp-project-id
property.description: Google Cloud Project ID

property.name: GCP Credentials Provider Service
property.description: The Controller Service used to obtain Google Cloud Platform credentials.

property.name: gcp-pubsub-topic
property.description: Name of the Google Cloud PubSub Topic

property.name: gcp-pubsub-publish-batch-size
property.description: Indicates the number of messages the cloud service should bundle together in a batch. If not set and left empty, only one message will be used in a batch

dynamicProperty.name: Attribute name
dynamicProperty.value: Value to be set to the attribute
dynamicProperty.description: Attributes to be set for the outgoing Google Cloud PubSub message

relationship.name: retry
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship if the Google Cloud Pub/Sub operation fails but attempting the operation again may succeed.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship after a successful Google Cloud Pub/Sub operation.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship if the Google Cloud Pub/Sub operation fails.

writesAttribute.name: gcp.pubsub.messageId
writesAttribute.description: ID of the pubsub message published to the configured Google Cloud PubSub topic

writesAttribute.name: gcp.pubsub.topic
writesAttribute.description: Name of the Google Cloud PubSub topic the message was published to

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.gcp.storage.DeleteGCSObject
extension.description: Deletes objects from a Google Cloud Bucket. If attempting to delete a file that does not exist, FlowFile is routed to success.

property.name: GCP Credentials Provider Service
property.description: The Controller Service used to obtain Google Cloud Platform credentials.

property.name: gcp-project-id
property.description: Google Cloud Project ID

property.name: gcp-retry-count
property.description: How many retry attempts should be made before routing to the failure relationship.

property.name: gcp-proxy-host
property.description: IP or hostname of the proxy to be used. You might need to set the following properties in bootstrap for https proxy usage: -Djdk.http.auth.tunneling.disabledSchemes= -Djdk.http.auth.proxying.disabledSchemes=

property.name: gcp-proxy-port
property.description: Proxy port number

property.name: gcp-proxy-user-name
property.description: HTTP Proxy Username

property.name: gcp-proxy-user-password
property.description: HTTP Proxy Password

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. If set, it supersedes proxy settings configured per component. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

property.name: gcs-bucket
property.description: Bucket of the object.

property.name: gcs-key
property.description: Name of the object.

property.name: gcs-generation
property.description: The generation of the object to be deleted. If null, will use latest version of the object.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship after a successful Google Cloud Storage operation.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship if the Google Cloud Storage operation fails.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.gcp.storage.FetchGCSObject
extension.description: Fetches a file from a Google Cloud Bucket. Designed to be used in tandem with ListGCSBucket.

property.name: GCP Credentials Provider Service
property.description: The Controller Service used to obtain Google Cloud Platform credentials.

property.name: gcp-project-id
property.description: Google Cloud Project ID

property.name: gcp-retry-count
property.description: How many retry attempts should be made before routing to the failure relationship.

property.name: gcp-proxy-host
property.description: IP or hostname of the proxy to be used. You might need to set the following properties in bootstrap for https proxy usage: -Djdk.http.auth.tunneling.disabledSchemes= -Djdk.http.auth.proxying.disabledSchemes=

property.name: gcp-proxy-port
property.description: Proxy port number

property.name: gcp-proxy-user-name
property.description: HTTP Proxy Username

property.name: gcp-proxy-user-password
property.description: HTTP Proxy Password

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. If set, it supersedes proxy settings configured per component. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

property.name: gcs-bucket
property.description: Bucket of the object.

property.name: gcs-key
property.description: Name of the object.

property.name: gcs-generation
property.description: The generation of the Object to download. If null, will download latest generation.

property.name: gcs-server-side-encryption-key
property.description: An AES256 Key (encoded in base64) which the object has been encrypted in.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship after a successful Google Cloud Storage operation.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship if the Google Cloud Storage operation fails.

writesAttribute.name: filename
writesAttribute.description: The name of the file, parsed if possible from the Content-Disposition response header

writesAttribute.name: gcs.bucket
writesAttribute.description: Bucket of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.key
writesAttribute.description: Name of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.size
writesAttribute.description: Size of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.cache.control
writesAttribute.description: Data cache control of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.component.count
writesAttribute.description: The number of components which make up the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.content.disposition
writesAttribute.description: The data content disposition of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.content.encoding
writesAttribute.description: The content encoding of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.content.language
writesAttribute.description: The content language of the object.

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: The MIME/Content-Type of the object

writesAttribute.name: gcs.crc32c
writesAttribute.description: The CRC32C checksum of object's data, encoded in base64 in big-endian order.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.create.time
writesAttribute.description: The creation time of the object (milliseconds)

writesAttribute.name: gcs.update.time
writesAttribute.description: The last modification time of the object (milliseconds)

writesAttribute.name: gcs.encryption.algorithm
writesAttribute.description: The algorithm used to encrypt the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.encryption.sha256
writesAttribute.description: The SHA256 hash of the key used to encrypt the object

writesAttribute.name: gcs.etag
writesAttribute.description: The HTTP 1.1 Entity tag for the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.generated.id
writesAttribute.description: The service-generated for the object

writesAttribute.name: gcs.generation
writesAttribute.description: The data generation of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.md5
writesAttribute.description: The MD5 hash of the object's data encoded in base64.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.media.link
writesAttribute.description: The media download link to the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.metageneration
writesAttribute.description: The metageneration of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.owner
writesAttribute.description: The owner (uploader) of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.owner.type
writesAttribute.description: The ACL entity type of the uploader of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.uri
writesAttribute.description: The URI of the object as a string.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.gcp.storage.ListGCSBucket
extension.description: Retrieves a listing of objects from an GCS bucket. For each object that is listed, creates a FlowFile that represents the object so that it can be fetched in conjunction with FetchGCSObject. This Processor is designed to run on Primary Node only in a cluster. If the primary node changes, the new Primary Node will pick up where the previous node left off without duplicating all of the data.

property.name: GCP Credentials Provider Service
property.description: The Controller Service used to obtain Google Cloud Platform credentials.

property.name: gcp-project-id
property.description: Google Cloud Project ID

property.name: gcp-retry-count
property.description: How many retry attempts should be made before routing to the failure relationship.

property.name: gcp-proxy-host
property.description: IP or hostname of the proxy to be used. You might need to set the following properties in bootstrap for https proxy usage: -Djdk.http.auth.tunneling.disabledSchemes= -Djdk.http.auth.proxying.disabledSchemes=

property.name: gcp-proxy-port
property.description: Proxy port number

property.name: gcp-proxy-user-name
property.description: HTTP Proxy Username

property.name: gcp-proxy-user-password
property.description: HTTP Proxy Password

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. If set, it supersedes proxy settings configured per component. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

property.name: gcs-bucket
property.description: Bucket of the object.

property.name: gcs-prefix
property.description: The prefix used to filter the object list. In most cases, it should end with a forward slash ('/').

property.name: gcs-use-generations
property.description: Specifies whether to use GCS Generations, if applicable. If false, only the latest version of each object will be returned.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship after a successful Google Cloud Storage operation.

writesAttribute.name: filename
writesAttribute.description: The name of the file

writesAttribute.name: gcs.bucket
writesAttribute.description: Bucket of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.key
writesAttribute.description: Name of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.size
writesAttribute.description: Size of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.cache.control
writesAttribute.description: Data cache control of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.component.count
writesAttribute.description: The number of components which make up the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.content.disposition
writesAttribute.description: The data content disposition of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.content.encoding
writesAttribute.description: The content encoding of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.content.language
writesAttribute.description: The content language of the object.

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: The MIME/Content-Type of the object

writesAttribute.name: gcs.crc32c
writesAttribute.description: The CRC32C checksum of object's data, encoded in base64 in big-endian order.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.create.time
writesAttribute.description: The creation time of the object (milliseconds)

writesAttribute.name: gcs.update.time
writesAttribute.description: The last modification time of the object (milliseconds)

writesAttribute.name: gcs.encryption.algorithm
writesAttribute.description: The algorithm used to encrypt the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.encryption.sha256
writesAttribute.description: The SHA256 hash of the key used to encrypt the object

writesAttribute.name: gcs.etag
writesAttribute.description: The HTTP 1.1 Entity tag for the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.generated.id
writesAttribute.description: The service-generated for the object

writesAttribute.name: gcs.generation
writesAttribute.description: The data generation of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.md5
writesAttribute.description: The MD5 hash of the object's data encoded in base64.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.media.link
writesAttribute.description: The media download link to the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.metageneration
writesAttribute.description: The metageneration of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.owner
writesAttribute.description: The owner (uploader) of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.owner.type
writesAttribute.description: The ACL entity type of the uploader of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.uri
writesAttribute.description: The URI of the object as a string.

stateful.description: After performing a listing of keys, the timestamp of the newest key is stored, along with the keys that share that same timestamp. This allows the Processor to list only keys that have been added or modified after this date the next time that the Processor is run. State is stored across the cluster so that this Processor can be run on Primary Node only and if a new Primary Node is selected, the new node can pick up where the previous node left off, without duplicating the data.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.gcp.pubsub.ConsumeGCPubSub
extension.description: Consumes message from the configured Google Cloud PubSub subscription. If the 'Batch Size' is set, the configured number of messages will be pulled in a single request, else only one message will be pulled.

property.name: gcp-project-id
property.description: Google Cloud Project ID

property.name: GCP Credentials Provider Service
property.description: The Controller Service used to obtain Google Cloud Platform credentials.

property.name: gcp-pubsub-subscription
property.description: Name of the Google Cloud Pub/Sub Subscription

property.name: gcp-pubsub-publish-batch-size
property.description: Indicates the number of messages the cloud service should bundle together in a batch. If not set and left empty, only one message will be used in a batch

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship after a successful Google Cloud Pub/Sub operation.

writesAttribute.name: gcp.pubsub.ackId
writesAttribute.description: Acknowledgement Id of the consumed Google Cloud PubSub message

writesAttribute.name: gcp.pubsub.messageSize
writesAttribute.description: Serialized size of the consumed Google Cloud PubSub message

writesAttribute.name: gcp.pubsub.attributesCount
writesAttribute.description: Number of attributes the consumed PubSub message has, if any

writesAttribute.name: gcp.pubsub.publishTime
writesAttribute.description: Timestamp value when the message was published

writesAttribute.name: Dynamic Attributes
writesAttribute.description: Other than the listed attributes, this processor may write zero or more attributes, if the original Google Cloud Publisher client added any attributes to the message while sending

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.gcp.storage.PutGCSObject
extension.description: Puts flow files to a Google Cloud Bucket.

property.name: GCP Credentials Provider Service
property.description: The Controller Service used to obtain Google Cloud Platform credentials.

property.name: gcp-project-id
property.description: Google Cloud Project ID

property.name: gcp-retry-count
property.description: How many retry attempts should be made before routing to the failure relationship.

property.name: gcp-proxy-host
property.description: IP or hostname of the proxy to be used. You might need to set the following properties in bootstrap for https proxy usage: -Djdk.http.auth.tunneling.disabledSchemes= -Djdk.http.auth.proxying.disabledSchemes=

property.name: gcp-proxy-port
property.description: Proxy port number

property.name: gcp-proxy-user-name
property.description: HTTP Proxy Username

property.name: gcp-proxy-user-password
property.description: HTTP Proxy Password

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. If set, it supersedes proxy settings configured per component. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

property.name: gcs-bucket
property.description: Bucket of the object.

property.name: gcs-key
property.description: Name of the object.

property.name: gcs-content-type
property.description: Content Type for the file, i.e. text/plain

property.name: gcs-object-md5
property.description: MD5 Hash (encoded in Base64) of the file for server-side validation.

property.name: gcs-object-crc32c
property.description: CRC32C Checksum (encoded in Base64, big-Endian order) of the file for server-side validation.

property.name: gcs-object-acl
property.description: Access Control to be attached to the object uploaded. Not providing this will revert to bucket defaults.

allowableValue.description: Gives the bucket or object owner OWNER permission, and gives all authenticated Google account holders READER and WRITER permissions. All other permissions are removed.
Gives the bucket or object owner OWNER permission, and gives all authenticated Google account holders READER permission. All other permissions are removed.
Gives the object and bucket owners OWNER permission. All other permissions are removed.
Gives the object owner OWNER permission, and gives the bucket owner READER permission. All other permissions are removed.
Gives the bucket or object owner OWNER permission for a bucket or object, and removes all other access permissions.

Gives permission to the project team based on their roles. Anyone who is part of the team has READER permission. Project owners and project editors have OWNER permission. This is the default ACL for newly created buckets. This is also the default ACL for newly created objects unless the default object ACL for that bucket has been changed.

Gives the bucket or object owner OWNER permission, and gives all users, both authenticated and anonymous, READER permission. When you apply this to an object, anyone on the Internet can read the object without authenticating.

property.name: gcs-server-side-encryption-key
property.description: An AES256 Encryption Key (encoded in base64) for server-side encryption of the object.

property.name: gcs-overwrite-object
property.description: If false, the upload to GCS will succeed only if the object does not exist.

property.name: gcs-content-disposition-type
property.description: Type of RFC-6266 Content Disposition to be attached to the object

allowableValue.description: Indicates that the object should be loaded and rendered within the browser.
Indicates that the object should be saved (using a Save As... dialog) rather than opened directly within the browser

dynamicProperty.name: The name of a User-Defined Metadata field to add to the GCS Object
dynamicProperty.value: The value of a User-Defined Metadata field to add to the GCS Object
dynamicProperty.description: Allows user-defined metadata to be added to the GCS object as key/value pairs

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship after a successful Google Cloud Storage operation.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship if the Google Cloud Storage operation fails.

readsAttribute.name: filename
readsAttribute.description: Uses the FlowFile's filename as the filename for the GCS object

readsAttribute.name: mime.type
readsAttribute.description: Uses the FlowFile's MIME type as the content-type for the GCS object

writesAttribute.name: gcs.bucket
writesAttribute.description: Bucket of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.key
writesAttribute.description: Name of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.size
writesAttribute.description: Size of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.cache.control
writesAttribute.description: Data cache control of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.component.count
writesAttribute.description: The number of components which make up the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.content.disposition
writesAttribute.description: The data content disposition of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.content.encoding
writesAttribute.description: The content encoding of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.content.language
writesAttribute.description: The content language of the object.

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: The MIME/Content-Type of the object

writesAttribute.name: gcs.crc32c
writesAttribute.description: The CRC32C checksum of object's data, encoded in base64 in big-endian order.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.create.time
writesAttribute.description: The creation time of the object (milliseconds)

writesAttribute.name: gcs.update.time
writesAttribute.description: The last modification time of the object (milliseconds)

writesAttribute.name: gcs.encryption.algorithm
writesAttribute.description: The algorithm used to encrypt the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.encryption.sha256
writesAttribute.description: The SHA256 hash of the key used to encrypt the object

writesAttribute.name: gcs.etag
writesAttribute.description: The HTTP 1.1 Entity tag for the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.generated.id
writesAttribute.description: The service-generated for the object

writesAttribute.name: gcs.generation
writesAttribute.description: The data generation of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.md5
writesAttribute.description: The MD5 hash of the object's data encoded in base64.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.media.link
writesAttribute.description: The media download link to the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.metageneration
writesAttribute.description: The metageneration of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.owner
writesAttribute.description: The owner (uploader) of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.owner.type
writesAttribute.description: The ACL entity type of the uploader of the object.

writesAttribute.name: gcs.uri
writesAttribute.description: The URI of the object as a string.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.gcp.bigquery.PutBigQueryBatch
extension.description: Batch loads flow files content to a Google BigQuery table.

property.name: GCP Credentials Provider Service
property.description: The Controller Service used to obtain Google Cloud Platform credentials.

property.name: gcp-project-id
property.description: Google Cloud Project ID

property.name: gcp-retry-count
property.description: How many retry attempts should be made before routing to the failure relationship.

property.name: gcp-proxy-host
property.description: IP or hostname of the proxy to be used. You might need to set the following properties in bootstrap for https proxy usage: -Djdk.http.auth.tunneling.disabledSchemes= -Djdk.http.auth.proxying.disabledSchemes=

property.name: gcp-proxy-port
property.description: Proxy port number

property.name: gcp-proxy-user-name
property.description: HTTP Proxy Username

property.name: gcp-proxy-user-password
property.description: HTTP Proxy Password

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. If set, it supersedes proxy settings configured per component. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

property.name: bq.dataset
property.description: BigQuery dataset name (Note - The dataset must exist in GCP)

property.name: bq.table.name
property.description: BigQuery table name

property.name: bq.load.ignore_unknown
property.description: Sets whether BigQuery should allow extra values that are not represented in the table schema. If true, the extra values are ignored. If false, records with extra columns are treated as bad records, and if there are too many bad records, an invalid error is returned in the job result. By default unknown values are not allowed.

property.name: bq.table.schema
property.description: BigQuery schema in JSON format

property.name: bq.readtimeout
property.description: Load Job Time Out

property.name: bq.load.type
property.description: Data type of the file to be loaded. Possible values: AVRO, NEWLINE_DELIMITED_JSON, CSV.

property.name: bq.load.create_disposition
property.description: Sets whether the job is allowed to create new tables

allowableValue.description: Configures the job to create the table if it does not exist.
Configures the job to fail with a not-found error if the table does not exist.

property.name: bq.load.write_disposition
property.description: Sets the action that should occur if the destination table already exists.

allowableValue.description: Configures the job to fail with a duplicate error if the table already exists.
Configures the job to append data to the table if it already exists.
Configures the job to overwrite the table data if table already exists.

property.name: bq.load.max_badrecords
property.description: Sets the maximum number of bad records that BigQuery can ignore when running the job. If the number of bad records exceeds this value, an invalid error is returned in the job result. By default no bad record is ignored.

property.name: bq.csv.allow.jagged.rows
property.description: Set whether BigQuery should accept rows that are missing trailing optional columns. If true, BigQuery treats missing trailing columns as null values. If false, records with missing trailing columns are treated as bad records, and if there are too many bad records, an invalid error is returned in the job result. By default, rows with missing trailing columns are considered bad records.

property.name: bq.csv.allow.quoted.new.lines
property.displayName: CSV Input - Allow Quoted New Lines
property.description: Sets whether BigQuery should allow quoted data sections that contain newline characters in a CSV file. By default quoted newline are not allowed.

property.name: bq.csv.charset
property.description: Sets the character encoding of the data.

property.name: bq.csv.delimiter
property.description: Sets the separator for fields in a CSV file. BigQuery converts the string to ISO-8859-1 encoding, and then uses the first byte of the encoded string to split the data in its raw, binary state. BigQuery also supports the escape sequence " " to specify a tab separator. The default value is a comma (',').

property.name: bq.csv.quote
property.description: Sets the value that is used to quote data sections in a CSV file. BigQuery converts the string to ISO-8859-1 encoding, and then uses the first byte of the encoded string to split the data in its raw, binary state. The default value is a double-quote ('"'). If your data does not contain quoted sections, set the property value to an empty string. If your data contains quoted newline characters, you must also set the Allow Quoted New Lines property to true.

property.name: bq.csv.skip.leading.rows
property.description: Sets the number of rows at the top of a CSV file that BigQuery will skip when reading the data. The default value is 0. This property is useful if you have header rows in the file that should be skipped.

property.name: bq.avro.use.logical.types
property.description: If format is set to Avro and if this option is set to true, you can interpret logical types into their corresponding types (such as TIMESTAMP) instead of only using their raw types (such as INTEGER).

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship after a successful Google BigQuery operation.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship if the Google BigQuery operation fails.

writesAttribute.name: bq.job.stat.creation_time
writesAttribute.description: Time load job creation

writesAttribute.name: bq.job.stat.end_time
writesAttribute.description: Time load job ended

writesAttribute.name: bq.job.stat.start_time
writesAttribute.description: Time load job started

writesAttribute.name: bq.job.link
writesAttribute.description: API Link to load job

writesAttribute.name: bq.error.message
writesAttribute.description: Load job error message

writesAttribute.name: bq.error.reason
writesAttribute.description: Load job error reason

writesAttribute.name: bq.error.location
writesAttribute.description: Load job error location

writesAttribute.name: bq.records.count
writesAttribute.description: Number of records successfully inserted

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.gcp.credentials.service.GCPCredentialsControllerService
extension.description: Defines credentials for Google Cloud Platform processors. Uses Application Default credentials without configuration. Application Default credentials support environmental variable (GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS) pointing to a credential file, the config generated by `gcloud auth application-default login`, AppEngine/Compute Engine service accounts, etc.

property.name: application-default-credentials
property.description: If true, uses Google Application Default Credentials, which checks the GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS environment variable for a filepath to a service account JSON key, the config generated by the gcloud sdk, the App Engine service account, and the Compute Engine service account.

property.name: compute-engine-credentials
property.description: If true, uses Google Compute Engine Credentials of the Compute Engine VM Instance which NiFi is running on.

property.name: service-account-json-file
property.description: Path to a file containing a Service Account key file in JSON format.

property.name: service-account-json
property.description: The raw JSON containing a Service Account keyfile.

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN
